availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James R. Williams (Madison County, Kentucky, merchant, gentleman, and farmer)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, merchant, gentleman, and farmer. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Ann M. Miller Williams in Madison County, Kentucky, on January 10, 1849. Father of William Williams. Merchant in Madison County in 1850. Gentleman in Madison County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Farmer in Madison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 203A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision, p. 257.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision, p. 470A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Madison County, KY, October 1863, p. 110.
Kentucky Birth Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Madison County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183302, p. 24.
